channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Sinkhole has appeared in the last day or so, 23rd February
item.description:
Extensive existing road damage has now led to a sinkhole opening up.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Royal Place, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nuisance Parking, 23rd February
item.description:
We’ve been facing some challenges with parking due to a vehicle that often stays outside our gateway for extended periods, sometimes up to a week without moving. This has created considerable stress for us, especially when it comes to assisting my elderly mother, who is 75 and relies on a walking stick. With the limited space, it’s tough for us to help her get in and out of our cars safely. We genuinely appreciate your understanding and would be grateful if double yellow lines could be considered for this area. This change would greatly ease the burden of parking while we help our mother with heavy groceries and during her daily outings. Thank you so much for your consideration.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anton Road, South Ockendon
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light not working o/s 2-4 Dansington Road, 23rd February
item.description:
The light stopped working on Friday night please can this be fixed asap as it is very dark.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dansington Road, Welling, Greater London

item.title: Corner of Hollycroft and Ferncroft Avenues, 23rd February
item.description:
The sign has a lot of letters missing and looks like it’s been burnt off and vandalised. Very concerning as this is important for post to be delivered to the correct address and also worrying that there is clearly vandalism.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hollycroft Avenue, West Hampstead, Greater London

item.title: Severely damaged street name sign – Hollycroft Avenue NW3, 23rd February
item.description:
The Hollycroft Avenue NW3 street name sign (mounted on the fence at the corner) has been severely burnt and is heavily charred. Parts of the sign are missing and the lettering is no longer clearly legible. It appears to require full replacement. Photo attached. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hollycroft Avenue, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sand underneath Butterfield playground trampoline, 23rd February
item.description:
There is a trampoline next to the sandpit at the Butterfield play area. There is a lot of sand underneath the trampoline. This means it barely bounces, which is sad because it's a popular piece with kids. Please could we have the sand removed?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wordsworth Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
